key_points: Tulio de Oliveira urges attention to the interactions between COVID-19 and HIV.
Failure to provide COVID-19 vaccines to high HIV rate nations risks greater danger and coronavirus variants emergence.
COVID-19 pandemic caused drug shortages and treatment challenges for those with HIV.
People with HIV are 30-50% more likely to die from COVID-19, with greater risk in those with advanced HIV.
Prolonged infections in immunocompromised individuals, like those with advanced HIV, can lead to concerning coronavirus variants.
Sub-Saharan Africa is significantly affected due to high HIV prevalence and insufficient antiretroviral therapy coverage.
COVID-19 pandemic disruptions have strained healthcare, reduced HIV testing, and affected prevention programs.
Africa lags in COVID-19 vaccine access, with less than 7% fully vaccinated compared to global 40%.
COVAX initiative falling short of its goal to distribute two billion vaccine doses by end of 2021.
Call for action to simultaneously tackle COVID-19 and HIV, potentially benefiting global health.
spokespersons: Tulio de Oliveira (Director, Centre for Epidemic Response and Innovation, Stellenbosch University)
